title: Did Kim Kardashian delete son Saint West's YouTube channel after anti-Harris post?
content: Kim Kardashian has removed her eight-year-old son Saint West's YouTube channel after he posted two controversial videos criticizing Vice President Kamala Harris. Saint's videos drew backlash featuring offensive memes and clips. Kardashian, who monitors his content, enforced their agreement rules by taking down his account, highlighting the family's contrasting political affiliations.
summary: Kim Kardashian has removed her eight-year-old son Saint West's YouTube channel after he posted two controversial videos criticizing Vice President Kamala Harris. Saint's videos drew backlash featuring offensive memes and clips. Kardashian, who monitors his content, enforced their agreement rules by taking down his account, highlighting the family's contrasting political affiliations.

title: Watch: Office of Sheikh Hasina’s coalition party attacked in Bangladesh, set ablaze
content: A violent mob vandalised and set fire to the Jatiya Party's central office in Dhaka after clashes erupted during a torch procession. Protesters condemned the Jatiya Party's ties with the Awami League. Police and army were deployed as the fire was contained. No immediate comment from the Jatiya Party.
summary: A violent mob vandalised and set fire to the Jatiya Party's central office in Dhaka after clashes erupted during a torch procession. Protesters condemned the Jatiya Party's ties with the Awami League. Police and army were deployed as the fire was contained. No immediate comment from the Jatiya Party.

title: NBA superstar LeBron James endorses VP Kamala Harris for Presidential bid
content: NBA star LeBron James endorsed Kamala Harris in the US Presidential elections, emphasizing the importance of voting. He shared a video criticizing Trump's statements and actions towards African Americans, highlighting civil rights abuses and racist rhetoric. James, known for his political involvement, has supported Joe Biden in 2020 and Hillary Clinton in 2016.
summary: NBA star LeBron James endorsed Kamala Harris in the US Presidential elections, emphasizing the importance of voting. He shared a video criticizing Trump's statements and actions towards African Americans, highlighting civil rights abuses and racist rhetoric. James, known for his political involvement, has supported Joe Biden in 2020 and Hillary Clinton in 2016.

title: North Korea says test-fire perfected new solid-fuel missile 'Hwasong-19': What it means
content: North Korea tested the Hwasong-19 ICBM, claiming it as the world's strongest with enhanced altitude and flight capabilities. Kim Jong Un described it as a response to national security threats. Officials suggest solid fuel technology was used, offering faster launches. Meanwhile, international criticism arises over North Korea's troop deployment to Russia.
summary: North Korea tested the Hwasong-19 ICBM, claiming it as the world's strongest with enhanced altitude and flight capabilities. Kim Jong Un described it as a response to national security threats. Officials suggest solid fuel technology was used, offering faster launches. Meanwhile, international criticism arises over North Korea's troop deployment to Russia.

title: Indian man requests Selena Gomez to say ‘Jai Shree Ram’; see her response
content: A video shows a man asking pop star Selena Gomez to chant 'Jai Shree Ram' during a selfie at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival. Selena looks confused and politely replies without chanting. The video, shared during Diwali celebrations on Instagram, sparked negative reactions and went viral on social media, amassing millions of views.
summary: A video shows a man asking pop star Selena Gomez to chant 'Jai Shree Ram' during a selfie at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival. Selena looks confused and politely replies without chanting. The video, shared during Diwali celebrations on Instagram, sparked negative reactions and went viral on social media, amassing millions of views.

title: ‘Will strengthen partnership with good friend PM Modi’: Trump's Diwali message to Hindu Americans
content: Former President Trump vowed to protect Hindu Americans from the radical left's anti-religion agenda, pledged to strengthen US-India relations, and condemned violence against minorities in Bangladesh. Trump contrasted his administration's policies with those of Biden and Harris, emphasizing economic growth and regulatory reform.
summary: Former President Trump vowed to protect Hindu Americans from the radical left's anti-religion agenda, pledged to strengthen US-India relations, and condemned violence against minorities in Bangladesh. Trump contrasted his administration's policies with those of Biden and Harris, emphasizing economic growth and regulatory reform.

title: How're world's trees doing? Here's an assessment
content: More than one-third of the world's tree species face extinction, according to a comprehensive assessment by the International Union for Conservation of Nature. Island biodiversity is particularly vulnerable. Agriculture, logging, and urbanisation are significant threats, with climate change as an emerging concern. The findings were presented at the UN biodiversity conference in Colombia.
summary: More than one-third of the world's tree species face extinction, according to a comprehensive assessment by the International Union for Conservation of Nature. Island biodiversity is particularly vulnerable. Agriculture, logging, and urbanisation are significant threats, with climate change as an emerging concern. The findings were presented at the UN biodiversity conference in Colombia.

title: SpaceX gets into spy game
content: The Pentagon's Space Development Agency achieved a significant milestone by successfully using lasers to transmit data at light speed between military satellites, enhancing missile tracking and defense. This marks a pivotal moment for SpaceX, which is now expanding into military and spy satellite construction, raising questions about its dominance and Elon Musk's foreign relations.
summary: The Pentagon's Space Development Agency achieved a significant milestone by successfully using lasers to transmit data at light speed between military satellites, enhancing missile tracking and defense. This marks a pivotal moment for SpaceX, which is now expanding into military and spy satellite construction, raising questions about its dominance and Elon Musk's foreign relations.

title: ‘Happy to talk’: Investigators speak to male escorts about Diddy’s infamous ‘freak off’ parties
content: The FBI is investigating Sean 'Diddy' Combs' alleged 'Freak Off' sex parties, interviewing male prostitutes about the events, drugs, and participants. The investigation includes seized videos and objects from Combs' homes. Authorities seek to determine whether participants were underage or coerced, while Combs denies wrongdoing, facing serious charges including racketeering and sex trafficking.
summary: The FBI is investigating Sean 'Diddy' Combs' alleged 'Freak Off' sex parties, interviewing male prostitutes about the events, drugs, and participants. The investigation includes seized videos and objects from Combs' homes. Authorities seek to determine whether participants were underage or coerced, while Combs denies wrongdoing, facing serious charges including racketeering and sex trafficking.

title: Blast kills man in apartment in Greek capital; anti-terrorism probe launched
content: An explosion in an Athens apartment resulted in the death of a man and serious injury to a woman. Greek anti-terrorism police are investigating the incident, suspecting an explosive device caused the blast. The explosion severely damaged the building, and fire brigade officials evacuated the injured woman and recovered the man's body.
summary: An explosion in an Athens apartment resulted in the death of a man and serious injury to a woman. Greek anti-terrorism police are investigating the incident, suspecting an explosive device caused the blast. The explosion severely damaged the building, and fire brigade officials evacuated the injured woman and recovered the man's body.

title: Who is Karthik Naralasetty? Indian-American tech innovator who could be Texas’s youngest mayor
Super Typhoon Kong-rey makes landfall in Taiwan, strongest storm in decades
Russian bomb hits residential building in Ukraine's 2nd largest city, killing 12-year-old boy
content: Russian forces attacked a residential building in Kharkiv, killing a 12-year-old boy and injuring at least 35 others. The attack utilized a 500-kg glide bomb, part of increased Russian assaults using powerful glide bombs. President Zelenskyy urged the U.S. for long-range American missiles to combat these attacks closely.
summary: Russian forces attacked a residential building in Kharkiv, killing a 12-year-old boy and injuring at least 35 others. The attack utilized a 500-kg glide bomb, part of increased Russian assaults using powerful glide bombs. President Zelenskyy urged the U.S. for long-range American missiles to combat these attacks closely.

title: 'If they want to stop ...': New Hezbollah chief open to truce with Israel if offer is made
content: Hezbollah's new leader, Naim Qassem, signaled willingness for a ceasefire with Israel, demanding specific conditions. Negotiations include Israel's call for Hezbollah's withdrawal and Lebanese army deployment along the border. Lebanon and Israeli officials express cautious optimism, while US diplomatic efforts continue amid ongoing conflict in Lebanon and Gaza, generating significant casualties.
summary: Hezbollah's new leader, Naim Qassem, signaled willingness for a ceasefire with Israel, demanding specific conditions. Negotiations include Israel's call for Hezbollah's withdrawal and Lebanese army deployment along the border. Lebanon and Israeli officials express cautious optimism, while US diplomatic efforts continue amid ongoing conflict in Lebanon and Gaza, generating significant casualties.

title: North Korea conducts ICBM test to boost nuclear deterrent, US slams move
content: North Korea tested a new intercontinental ballistic missile under Kim Jong Un's orders, aiming to showcase its military power. The US, Japan, and South Korea condemned the launch as destabilizing. Officials are concerned about North Korea's emerging solid-fueled missile technology and potential military involvement in the Ukraine conflict.
summary: North Korea tested a new intercontinental ballistic missile under Kim Jong Un's orders, aiming to showcase its military power. The US, Japan, and South Korea condemned the launch as destabilizing. Officials are concerned about North Korea's emerging solid-fueled missile technology and potential military involvement in the Ukraine conflict.

title: Taiwan on high alert: Typhoon Kong-rey prompts shutdowns and evacuations across island
content: Taiwan braces for Typhoon Kong-rey, prompting island-wide shutdown, with schools, offices, and markets closed. The storm, potentially the largest in 30 years, is expected to hit as a Category 4 hurricane. Evacuations and flight cancellations are underway. The government's preparations include mobilization of military personnel and emergency measures to ensure safety and minimal operational disruptions.
summary: Taiwan braces for Typhoon Kong-rey, prompting island-wide shutdown, with schools, offices, and markets closed. The storm, potentially the largest in 30 years, is expected to hit as a Category 4 hurricane. Evacuations and flight cancellations are underway. The government's preparations include mobilization of military personnel and emergency measures to ensure safety and minimal operational disruptions.

title: Chinese company wins contract to print Nepal's new notes with revised map including Indian regions
content: Nepal Rastra Bank awarded a contract to a Chinese company to print new 100-rupee notes featuring Nepal's revised political map, including Indian territories. The Chinese firm will print and supply 300 million notes at a cost of $8.99 million. The updated map has strained India-Nepal relations since 2020.
summary: Nepal Rastra Bank awarded a contract to a Chinese company to print new 100-rupee notes featuring Nepal's revised political map, including Indian territories. The Chinese firm will print and supply 300 million notes at a cost of $8.99 million. The updated map has strained India-Nepal relations since 2020.

title: North Korea fires long-range missile with potential to reach US mainland
content: North Korea launched a new long-range missile, reaching a range of over 7,000 km, causing reactions from the US, Japan, and South Korea. This test heightens tensions amid reports of North Korea's rising cooperation with Russia. US national security condemned the launch and suggested potential military drills in response. Concerns grow over North Korea's advancing missile capabilities.
summary: North Korea launched a new long-range missile, reaching a range of over 7,000 km, causing reactions from the US, Japan, and South Korea. This test heightens tensions amid reports of North Korea's rising cooperation with Russia. US national security condemned the launch and suggested potential military drills in response. Concerns grow over North Korea's advancing missile capabilities.

title: Israel demands resignation of UN expert Francesca Albanese over 'genocidal campaign against Palestinians' remark
content: Israel has demanded the resignation of UN expert Francesca Albanese after she accused Israel of carrying out a genocidal campaign against Palestinians. Israeli officials have labeled her remarks as anti-Semitic and a distortion of the law. Albanese defended her statements, highlighting the risk of Palestinians being eradicated from their land.
summary: Israel has demanded the resignation of UN expert Francesca Albanese after she accused Israel of carrying out a genocidal campaign against Palestinians. Israeli officials have labeled her remarks as anti-Semitic and a distortion of the law. Albanese defended her statements, highlighting the risk of Palestinians being eradicated from their land.

title: UN: Must probe all deaths during Bangladesh uprising
content: UN human rights chief Volker Turk urges investigations into recent killings in Bangladesh and stresses the importance of freedom of assembly, expression, and political participation. Turk highlights the need for accountability for attacks on minorities, emphasizing that thorough investigations are crucial for building trust and social cohesion.
summary: UN human rights chief Volker Turk urges investigations into recent killings in Bangladesh and stresses the importance of freedom of assembly, expression, and political participation. Turk highlights the need for accountability for attacks on minorities, emphasizing that thorough investigations are crucial for building trust and social cohesion.
